private_information: I arrive at Richmond District at 09:00.
I want to meet as many friends as possible today.
I must meet Betty for at least 60 minutes.
I prefer short walking or rest breaks between meetings when possible.
Default minimum meeting duration with any friend is 15 minutes unless specified otherwise.
traveler.goal: Maximize the number of distinct friends met in one day while guaranteeing a meeting of at least 60 minutes with Betty and respecting travel times and availabilities.

private_information: I will be at Financial District from 17:15 to 21:45.
I am flexible within that window and can meet for an hour or more.
My location is Financial District for the whole window.
friend_betty.goal: Share an accurate availability window and location so the traveler can plan a meeting of at least 60 minutes.

private_information: I maintain lightweight availability windows and locations for other friends besides Betty.
All other friends are located either in Richmond District or Financial District.
Windows are within the traveler's day (09:00 to 21:45).
friends_coordinator.goal: Provide consolidated availability and location data for other friends to enable schedule optimization.

private_information: I provide directed travel times between districts in minutes.
I only return routes for known locations.
routing_engine.goal: Return reliable, directed travel-time edges between Richmond District and Financial District.

private_information: I coordinate all inputs, generate and compare multiple candidate schedules, select the best one, and then produce a final PDDL domain and problem compatible with the FastDownward solver.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate data from all agents, explore alternative schedules, select an optimal one that maximizes the number of distinct friends met while ensuring at least 60 minutes with Betty, and produce a final PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownward.

public_information: You arrive at Richmond District at 09:00.
Betty will be at Financial District from 17:15 to 21:45.
You want to meet Betty for at least 60 minutes.
Travel time Richmond District -> Financial District: 22 minutes.
Travel time Financial District -> Richmond District: 21 minutes.
Objective: maximize the number of distinct friends met; tie-break by maximizing total face-to-face minutes; always respect travel-time and availability constraints.

preferences.system_prompt: You are the traveler describing your objectives and constraints. Output a compact JSON object with keys: start_location (one of environment.init.locations), arrival_time (HH:MM 24h), objective (string summarizing maximize-meetings, tie-break on total minutes), minimum_meeting_minutes_default (int), required_meetings (array of objects with person, location, min_minutes, window [start,end]), soft_preferences (array of strings such as minimize_travel, prefer_evenly_spaced_breaks). Do not emit PDDL.
preferences.prompt: Your name is traveler. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->traveler->private_information}. Provide the requested JSON preferences only, no explanations.

availability.system_prompt: You are Betty providing your availability. Output a compact JSON object with keys: name ('Betty'), location ('financial_district'), availability_windows (array with one or more [start,end] in HH:MM 24h), meeting_flexibility_minutes (suggested minimum meeting length you can accommodate, e.g., 60). Do not emit PDDL.
availability.prompt: Your name is friend_betty. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->friend_betty->private_information}. Provide the requested JSON availability only.

friends_availability.system_prompt: You provide availability data for additional friends. Output a compact JSON array, each element an object with keys: name, location (richmond_district or financial_district), availability_windows (array of [start,end] pairs), min_meeting_minutes (int). Include at least 3 friends with realistic windows between 09:00 and 21:45. Do not emit PDDL.
friends_availability.prompt: Your name is friends_coordinator. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->friends_coordinator->private_information}. Provide the requested JSON array only.

travel_times.system_prompt: You provide directed travel times between districts. Output a compact JSON object with keys: locations (array), edges (array of objects with from, to, minutes). Include the edges Richmond District -> Financial District (22) and Financial District -> Richmond District (21). Do not emit PDDL.
travel_times.prompt: Your name is routing_engine. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Provide the requested JSON travel-time graph only.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL for the FastDownward solver. Integrate all inputs, enumerate multiple feasible schedules, evaluate them by maximizing the number of distinct friends met (primary) and total face-to-face minutes (secondary), enforce that Betty is met for at least 60 minutes within her window, and respect directed travel times. Produce a classical PDDL domain and problem compatible with FastDownward (no durative actions). Represent time using discrete 5-minute ticks from 09:00 to 21:45 (create time objects and a successor predicate, and use actions that advance time accordingly). Include actions move(from,to,t_start,t_end) that require adjacency via the directed edges and t_end being the appropriate successor reached after the travel duration, and meet(person,location,t_start,t_end) that requires being at location throughout the interval and advances time by the meeting duration. Encode minimum durations by chaining over successive 5-minute ticks. The goal must require meeting Betty for at least 60 minutes and optionally encode meeting as many other distinct friends as possible; if necessary, choose and hard-code the best schedule identified from the inputs. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Output only the PDDL domain and problem with those tags.
pddl.prompt: There are multiple agents providing inputs you must integrate. The global objective is: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. You will receive: the traveler's preferences {preferences_summary}, Betty's availability {availability_betty}, other friends' availabilities {availability_others}, and directed travel times {routes_matrix}. Consider multiple feasible schedules that start at Richmond District at 09:00, respect travel times, fit within each friend's windows, and include at least 60 minutes with Betty in the Financial District window 17:15-21:45. Select the best schedule per the stated optimization criteria and produce the final PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownward solver. Enclose your outputs within <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags only.
